title: Are there any living relatives of George Washington? - Quora

response.answer_text: I found this 10/8/2008 article which was enlightening by Michelle Roberts, of NBC News: “SAN ANTONIO — A genealogy Web site says it has found the king of America — or rather, the descendant of George Washington's family who would have most likely held the title had the nation's first president been its first monarch instead. Long live Paul Emerson Washington, 82, of San Antonio, a retired regional manager for a building supply company. Paul Washington is the one among 8,000 possible Washington descendants that the chief family historian at Genealogy, Family Trees & Family History Records believes would currently hold the crown — had there been one. "He kind of won the sweepstakes," said Megan Smolenyak, with the genealogical research group. George Washington had no children. He had an older half brother, Augustine, and a younger brother, Samuel. Many descendants died young or as lifelong bachelors. Other Washington descendants had only daughters, Smolenyak said.” There’s more, but knowing that the family had 8000 descendants is impressive - they just weren’t direct descendants of George

There are two ways to answer this: (1) No! George Washington did not have any children, so there are no direct descendents of George Washington alive today, and never have been. (2) Yes! Almost anyone can trace his/her documented lineage to somewhere on George Washington's documented family tree, by climbing his tree upwards a few generations and then coming back down again. I mean, if you think about it for a moment, everyone can trace his or her lineage to any other person's family tree, if you go back far enough; we are all related to each other.
